name: reimplant
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to fix something, especially a part of the body, back in the place where it was before: Once the eggs have been fertilized the doctors re-implant them in the mother. The doctors were unable to re-implant the healthy kidney. Related word
implant
More examplesFewer examplesThe dentist was able to reimplant a tooth that had been knocked out eight hours earlier.They can fertilize eggs that are not affected by the faulty gene and then reimplant these into the mother's womb.The surgeon removed the tumour before re-implanting the liver.
